conversation.message:
Dear School_C Admissions,

Thank you again for considering my earlier application. I noticed School_C is still unmatched at this stage, and I remain very interested in attending.

Could you please let me know whether there is still an available seat and whether you are open to reconsidering candidates (e.g., via a waitlist or updated information)? If there’s anything specific you would like me to provide—an updated statement of interest, recent grades, or additional details—I would be happy to send it promptly.

Sincerely,
Student_E

I will use [TALK] (not a redundant re-application) to express continued strong interest, ask if the seat is still available, and whether there is any waitlist/reconsideration path or additional information they would like to see.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

Thank you for following up. Yes—our seat is still unfilled at the moment, and we are open to reconsidering candidates as the cycle progresses.

At this stage, we’re continuing to review interest while we monitor whether higher-priority candidates engage with us in the next rounds. If you’d like to remain under consideration, please send (1) any recent grade updates or exam results, and (2) a brief note confirming that School_C remains your top choice and that you would accept immediately if offered.

We appreciate your continued interest and will update you as soon as we’re in a position to make a final decision.

Sincerely,
School_C Admissions

On documents: there is nothing additional you need to send right now. If we reach the point of making an offer, we may request an official score/grade sheet for our records, but it is not required to keep you under consideration.

We appreciate your continued interest and will keep you updated.

Sincerely,
